title: Polki & Pearl Chandbali Earrings - Traditional Andhra Nathulu Design
materials: 22K Gold with Hyderabadi Polish. Features meticulously set Polki diamonds (uncut diamonds) and lustrous South Sea Pearls. Enhanced with smaller pearl accents.
features: These Chandbali style earrings showcase a classic lotus motif rendered with shimmering Polki diamonds. The pear-shaped Polki stones are carefully chosen for their unique clarity and fire. Three genuine South Sea Pearls dangle gracefully, adding a touch of traditional elegance. Intricate gold detailing completes the look, showcasing traditional Hyderabadi craftsmanship.
colors: Predominantly gold with a contrasting shimmer from the Polki diamonds (ranging from white to subtle grey tones). The pearls offer a creamy white luster
creating a soft and elegant palette.
occasions: traditional Telugu ceremonies like Seemantham and Pelli Kuthuru function
or adding a touch of South Indian heritage to any special event. These earrings are equally suitable for elegant evening wear.
description: These earrings are a stunning blend of traditional South Indian design and fine craftsmanship. The use of Polki diamonds offers a timeless elegance and a connection to royal heritage. The lustrous South Sea Pearls add a touch of sophistication and femininity. Crafted with 22K gold and given the special Hyderabadi polish for durability and a rich, lasting sheen, these earrings are a valuable investment and a cherished heirloom.
